subject: RE: [junit] VA Java import
msgSnippet: Just post it to the files directory here: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/ -Jason
messageBody:
Just post it to the files directory here:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/

-Jason

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Michael Silverstein [mailto:msilverstein@...]
> Sent: Monday, August 27, 2001 10:39 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] VA Java import
>
>
> We regularly build VA Java versions of JUnit (.dat and
> .pr files) for our
> own internal purposes. I'd be happy to make that publicly
> downloadable, if
> anyone's interested. If so, where would be a good place
> to link to it from?
>
> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> Mike Silverstein
> SilverMark, Inc.
> The object testing company
> http://www.silvermark.com
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jason.rogers@...]
> > Sent: Monday, August 27, 2001 7:20 AM
> > To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> > Subject: RE: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
> >
> >
> > We are running 3.5.2...
> >
> > Are you still trying to run with the JUnit jar? If so,
> move away
> > from that.
> > Import the source into VAJ in a new project called JUnit, or
> > whatever suits
> > your fancy.
>
